metadata.title: CVE-2019-10156 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was discovered in the way Ansible templating was implemented inversions before 2.6.18, 2.7.12 and 2.8.2, causing the possibility ofinformation disclosure through unexpected variable substitution. By takingadvantage of unintended variable substitution the content of any variablemay be disclosed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.5.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
